name: Residenza Ave Hotel

reviews.text: I will say that out of all three of the hotels we stayed in Italy, this would have to be the best overall. It is a small hotel, I think just 7 rooms. The rooms are at sidewalk level, but everything is just beautifully decorated. The room seemed spacious by European standards and had air-conditioning, a hairdryer, a safe, and a minibar. The owner, Salvo, is a wonderful man, who took quite some time to explain everything to us and answer all my questions. His staff was likewise gracious and very helpful. The location cannot be beat--right by the Tiber River, across from Castel S'Ant Angelo, a 10-minute walk to Vatican City, less than 5 minutes to Piazza Navona, and another 5 minutes beyond that to the Pantheon. I also felt very safe even late at night, because there were carabinieri posted at every corner it seemed. As Salvo pointed out, we were right across the courthouse and near a police academy.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel was the only one out of all three hotels we stayed at that changed the towels daily.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: They serve the breakfast in your room:coffee, juice, pastries.
reviews.title: not a good experience

reviews.text: The nearest Internet cafe I found was by the Vatican. There are a whole bunch of Internet cafes on the streets surrounding the Vatican, but one I used was located as such: if one was facing St. Peter's, it is to your left, about a block from St. Peter's Square. 1 euro per 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Very Unhappy

reviews.text: To get there from Termini, take the #40 bus and get off the Ponte Vittorio Emmanuel stop, which is 6 stops from Termini. Get off, walk by the road right next to the river. The hotel is about two and a half blocks from the stop. It is after Ponte Sant Angelo but before Ponte Umberto and on your right.
reviews.title: Great location
Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff
reviews.text: What a find! This hotel is within easy walking distance to every major Rome site with the exception of the Colliseum/Roman Forum. Salvo and Vera were great-Salvo took the time to point out all the sites on his provided map making navigating easy-we had one day in Rome and saw most of everything without rush- and Vera booked us an early morning cab with no problems. Salvo also had great and inexpensive restaurant recommendations. The rooms are quaint and as pictured although the decor is a little bit over the top, but the amenities are great. Clean hotel, good breakfast (although I was a little disapointed that the coffee was from a machine, not fresh made), great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This stop was the first hotel that we stayed in on our 2 week trip in Italy. Salvo and staff were awesome. Salvo gave us great tips on staying and traveling in Italy and even helped us take our bags the 1/4 mile to the taxi station. The room was very spacious and quiet with a great bathroom. This hotel is in walking distance to a lot of great tourist sights, bars and restaurants. If we ever went back to Italy we would definitely stay here again. Be sure to get a "Salvo" post card as a souvenir before you go.
reviews.title: Great location, outstanding staff

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my husband for 2 nights in September.
reviews.title: Charming oasis near the main sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is more of a B&B experience than a hotel experience. There are only a handful of rooms and the service is very personal and friendly.
reviews.title: Location, Loctation, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a warm welcome from Salvo and he was quick to assist with information and any requests we had. The lady who worked during the morning was also very friendly and pleasant but was perhaps a little out of her depth when things were not running smoothly. We asked her to book a taxi to take us to the train station and when she could not get through to any services by phone as the lines were busy she went into a bit of a panic and then went back to tidying the breakfast area. I had to ask her to continue trying as we really needed to make sure that we caught our train.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a super place. Super location, very friendly staff (thank you Salvo), very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay in Rome

likes.disliked: — Nothing - exactly what I thought I'd booked.

reviews.text: As others have said, if you want a full hotel service then this is not the place for you. However, if you want a super location and nice friendly service then it is. We will definitely try and book it again for our next visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel is in a perfect location for visiting the historic sights of Rome. Even though I visited it in the middle of July for 3 nights, I slept cool (with my own remote control for the air conditioning which worked fine when set at 19C), showered in the evenings prior to dinner with no loss of hot water, and had no problem from street noise even though my room was on the street side. There is a slight problem with the shower mixing valves when someone takes a shower simultaneously with you.
reviews.title: Utterly charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the hotel lacks a normal community area (the breakfast area is small, but useable), when we weren't sleeping or sight seeing and wanted to simply relax, we "hung out" at the Pantheon or the Piazza Navona. In the past I have stayed in more expensive hotels, but been too far for a casual walk to these places that I enjoy. For the price, this hotel exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: great short break hotel

reviews.text: Salvo was extremely helpful and recommended some delightful places to eat where we were treated royally. He offers an airport pickup and delivery service for 50E each way which I strongly recommend in such a busy time of year. The train from the airport to Termini Station in the city cost us 22E per person. It was standing room only on the train plus having to carry our bags. Then a 6E taxi ride from Termini Station to the hotel, which our driver had no trouble locating. Since there were 2 of us, it cost us 50E. A taxi from the airport is fixed in the summer at 60E to the City Wall, whatever that means. Needless to say, we used Salvo's driver to return to the airport for 50E and enjoyed a very pleasant ride.
reviews.title: Great Accommodation
Perfect trip to Roma....
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from visiting Rome, Italy where we celebrated our first anniversary. I had been to Rome prior and wanted a good balance between a hotel and pensione. Ave Roma was that and more. As with anything, everyone is different, but this place is great on location, hospitality and amenities. The staff will assist you in everything, there are only 7 rooms so you are taken care of quite well. The rooms are immaculate and the included breakfast is adorable and just enough to get your day going. Being but 2 minutes from Piazza Navona and 2 minutes from Vatican City is something you cannot beat.

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Residenza Ave Hotel in April '05. We wanted to be near the Piazza Navonna and across the river from St. Peter's. There are many hotels in this area, but since it is primo tourist territory the prices are also primo. Residenza Ave was so reasonable we wondered how decent it would be but decided to take a chance...and we were glad we did. We had none of the hot water problems another reviewer mentioned, and the place was clean and charming, thanks to manager Salvo, who was unfailingly helpful, and housekeeper Concetta, who brought us our wonderful cappuccino in the morning. For the price, you cannot beat this lovely place for its biggest asset: location, location, location. In the 9 days we were there we did not take public or private transportation anywhere, except to and from the airport. We walked EVERYWHERE, all day long -- and that is the real secret to enjoying any stay in Rome. If you go here expecting the bells and whistles of a luxury hotel you will be disappointed, but if you want a friendly, comfortable, homey refuge in the heart of the eternal city, this is your place!
reviews.title: A Homey Refuge in the Heart of the Eternal City

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time and enjoyed our stay at Residenza Ave Roma. The location is perfect - right on the Tiber River with the Vatican across the river and a couple blocks to the Piazza Navona, near the Pantheon and the best areas of Rome with many good places to eat and go out to (DO NOT miss Pizzareia Da Baffetto!!! Our best meal in Rome was also the cheapest and most fun!). Ave Roma is very quiet with just a handful of rooms down the one little hallway, all with bath. We never heard any of the other guests and the rooms were all full. I was there with my parents and there was plenty room for all three of us in our room with a queen bed and a small single for me. The decoration is romantic themed with angels but is not over the top and is tasteful.
reviews.title: Dream location, quiet and friendly with few minuses.

description: Residenza Ave Roma is your home in Rome. Come and visit us ...we will be glad to welcome and assist you during your stay. We are not a big impersonal hotel, but a small jewel in the heart of the historic centre.
